Subject: Non-integer stoichiometric coefficients
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=184860759
X-Yahoo-Profile: kvirgilm

I am trying to implement a 'global' mechanism for the gas phase reactions. 
I am specifying the reactions as such in the cti file: 
 
reaction( " CH4 + 1.5 O2 => CO + 2 H2O ", [5.3044e8, 0.1902, 13940.0], order 
= "CH4:0.587917 O2:0.620861") 
 
When I go to convert it to xml, I get the error: 
 
cti2ctml methane-3step.cti 
Traceback (most recent call last): 
  File "./.cttmp.py", line 7, in ? 
    execfile(file) 
  File "./methane-3step.cti", line 98, in ? 
    reaction( " CH4 + 1.5 O2 => CO + 2 H2O ", [5.3044e8, 0.1902, 13940.0], 
order = "CH4:0.587917 O2:0.620861") 
  File "/usr/lib/python2.2/site-packages/ctml_writer.py", line 643, in __init__ 
    self._r = getReactionSpecies(r) 
  File "/usr/lib/python2.2/site-packages/ctml_writer.py", line 323, in 
getReactionSpecies 
    n = int(t) 
ValueError: invalid literal for int(): 1.5 
 
 
Is there a simple fix to allow for non-integer stoichiometric coefficients?  I 
can manually enter these into the xml file, but then the c++ code crashes 
when it tries to import the gas-phase mechanism.
